specialRules.name: Martial Prowess
specialRules.description: High Elf models with this special rule can make supporting attackes with one extra rank than normal. This is cumulative with any other special rule that allows a unit to fight in extra ranks. In addition, when shooting, all High Elf models with this special rule fire in one more rank than normal (if the unit chooses to Volley Fire, this will normally mean that all of the models in the front three ranks, and half the models in the fourth and any subsequent ranks, are allowed to shoot). This is cumulative with any other special rule that allows a unit to shoot in extra ranks.

specialRules.name: Valour of Ages
specialRules.description: If your opponent's army roster contains one or more models from Warhammer: Dark Elves, models with this special rule re-roll all failed Panic, Fear and Terror tests.

specialRules.name: Lilieth's Blessing
specialRules.description: Models with this special rule add +1 to all attempts to cast spells from the Lord of High Magic.

specialRules.name: Fireborn
specialRules.description: Models with this rule have a 2+ ward save against Wounds caused by attacks that have the Flaming Attacks special rule.

specialRules.name: Arrows of Isha
specialRules.description: Shooting attacks made by a model who is attacking with a weapon that has this special rule are magical attacks. Models from the Forces of Destruction suffer an additional -1 to their armour saves against Wounds caused by Arrows of Isha.

specialRules.name: Shield of Saphery
specialRules.description: Each time a spell from this lore is successfully cast, the caster and his unit immediately gain +1 to their ward save (to a maximum ward save of 3+) until the beginning of the caster's next Magic phase. Models that do not already have a ward save instead gain a 6+ ward save (which can then be increased by further castings thanks to this lore attribute) until the beginning of the caster's next Magic phase.

specialRules.name: Deflect Shots
specialRules.description: Models with this special rule have a 6+ war save against non-magic shooting attacks that do not use templates.

stats.conditionalDescription: * 6+ ward against non-magic shooting attacks not using templates.

specialRules.name: Naval Discipline
specialRules.description:
If a unit containing at least one Sea Helm is successfully charged during the Movement phase, it can attempt to change formation immediately after your opponent has moved all of his charging units. To do so, the unit must take a Leadership test. If the test is passed, the Sea Helm's unit can immediately make a combat reform as described on page 55 of the Warhammer rulebook. If the test is failed, the unit cannot make a combat reform.
A unit cannot use the Naval Discipline rule if it made a Flee! or Stand and Shoot charge reaction that turn.

specialRules.name: Windrider
specialRules.description: A Sea Helm mounted on a Lothern Skycutter (and his Lothern Skycutter) has a 4+ ward save against shooting attacks. Furthermore, when mounted on a Lothern Skycutter, a Sea Helm re-rolls failed Dangerous Terrain tests.

stats.conditionalDescription: * 4+ ward save against shooting when mounted on Lothern Skycutter.

specialRules.name: Reckless
specialRules.description: A Dragon Mage has a +2 bonus to cast spells from the Lore of Fire (cumulative with other bonuses) but never receives bonuses (of any kind) to dispel attempts.

specialRules.name: Warrior Mage
specialRules.description: The first spell generated by a Dragon Mage is always Flaming Sword of Rhuin, regardless of the dice roll.

specialRules.name: Quicksilver Shot
specialRules.description: This model's shooting attacks have the Quick to Fire special rule, as do those of all Sisters of Avelorn and High Sisters in the same unit.

specialRules.name: Witness To Destiny
specialRules.description: A model with this special rule has a 4+ ward save.

specialRules.name: Blessings of Asuryan
specialRules.description: All models in a unit that contains an Anointed of Asuryan have a 6+ ward save and the Immune to Psychology Special rule.

optionItems.name: Bow of Avelorn
optionItems.description: The bow is used extensively in warfare. It is a compact, long-ranged weapon that is cheap to make and easy to maintain.

optionItems.name: Ithilmar Barding
optionItems.description: This gleaming armour is as strong as tempered steel, yet weighs no more than silk.

optionItems.name: Dragon Armor
optionItems.description: Forged in the heart of a volcano, this fine armour is enchanted to ward off the blows of the enemy and is all but impervious to Dragon fire.

optionItems.name: Lion Cloak
optionItems.description: The fur of a slain war lion is worn both as a sign of status and for protection from enemy arrows.

statChanges.conditionalDescription: * +2 to their armour save against non-magical shooting attacks.

optionItems.name: Drain Magic
optionItems.description: Drain Magic can eb cast on any unit (friend of foe) and has a range of 18". If the target is a friendly unit, Drain Magic is an augment spell. If the target is an enemy unit, Drain Magic is a hex spell. In either case all Remains in Play spells affecting the target are immediately dispelled, and the effects of all other spells on the target unit immediately come to an end. The Wizard can choose to have this spell target all units (friend and foe) within 18". If he does so, the casting value is increased to 14+.

optionItems.name: Soul Quench
optionItems.description: Soul Quench is a magic missile with a range of 18" that causes 2D6 Strengths 4 hits. The caster can choose for this spell to instead inflict 4D6 Strength 4 hits. If he does so, the casting value is increased to 16+.

optionItems.name: Apotheosis
optionItems.description: Apotheosis is an augment spell that targets a single model within 18". The target immediately reains a single lost Wound. The Wizard can choose to cast a more powerful version of Apotheosis. If he does so, the target instead immediately regains D3 lost Wounds, in which cast the casting value is increased to 10+. Regardless of how many lost Wounds (if any) are recovered, the target also gains the Fear special rule until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

optionItems.name: Hand of Glory
optionItems.description: Hand of Glory is an augment spell with a range of 18". The target unit's Weapon Skill, Ballistic Skill, Initiative or Movement (you choose which) is increased by D3 until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. The Wizard can choose to cast a more powerful version of this spell that instead increases all four characteristics (don't roll a separate D3 for each - make one roll and apply it to all four characteristics). If he does so, the casting value is increased to 10+.

optionItems.name: Walk Between Worlds
optionItems.description: Walk Between Worlds is an augment spell that targets a single unengaged unit within 24". The target gains the Ethereal special rule until the end of the phase and can immediately move up to 10" as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase. THe Wizard can choose to cast a more powerful version of this spell, in which the case the target instead gains the Ethereal special rule until the end of the phase and can immediately move up to 20" as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase. If he chooses to do so, the casting value is increased to 16+.

optionItems.name: Tempest
optionItems.description: Tempest is a direct damage spell. Place the large round template anywhere within 30" of the Wizard - it then scatters D6". All models hit by the template supper a strength 3 hit (models with the Fly special rule suffer a Strength 4 hit instead). If a unit suffers an unsaved Wounds from thsi spell, it suffers a -1 modifier to all To Hit rolls (both shooting and close combat) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase (shooting attacks that do no use Ballistic Skill must roll 4+ on a D6 before firing, or the shot(s) are lost).

optionItems.name: Arcane Unforgiving
optionItems.description: Arcane Unforgiving is a direct damage spell with a range of 24" that targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). The target suffers a single Wound on a dice roll greater than or equal to the model's unmodified armour save (models without an armour save cannot be wounded). No armour saves are permitted against a Wound caused by this spell. The owning player must then reveal to the caster all the magic items possessed by the target (if any). If the target has one or more magic items, randomly select one of them - that item is immediately destroyed on a roll of 2+ and cannot be used for the rest of the game. Note that this spell has no effect on magic items that are mounts, magic items that contain bound spells that have miscast during the game, and any magic items lavelled as 'one use only' that have already been used during the game - do not include these when randomly selecting a magic item.

optionItems.name: Fiery Convocation
optionItems.description: Remains in play. Fiery Convocation is a direct damage spell with a range of 24". Every model in the target unit takes a Strength 4 hit with the Flaming Attacks special rule. At the end of every subsequent Magic phase, every model in the target unit suffers a Strength 4 hit with the Flaming Attacks special rule.

optionItems.name: The Blade of Leaping Gold
optionItems.description: The Blade of Leaping Gold grants the wielder +3 Attacks. In additiion, any roll of 6 To Wound made with the Blade of Leaping Gold ignores armour saves.

specialRules.conditionalDescription: * Only on roll of 6 on To Wound roll.

optionItems.name: Star Lance
optionItems.description: Mounted character only. The Star Lance can only be used in a turn in which the bearer makes a successful charge. Attacks with the Star Lance are resolved at +3 Strength, and armour saves cannot be taken against Wounds caused by the Star Lance. If the bearer did not make a make a successful charge this turn, or if his mount has been slain, he must instead fight using another weapon.

statChanges.conditionalDescription: * Mounted only on the turn user charged.

specialRules.conditionalDescription: * Mounted only on the turn user charged.

optionItems.name: The Reaver Bow
optionItems.description: +1 strength, Volley Fire, Multiple Shots (3)

statChanges.conditionalDescription: * Only for the ranged bow attacks.

optionItems.name: Armour of Caledor
optionItems.description: The Armour of Caledor grants the wearer a 2+ armour save that cannot be improved by any means. In addition, the Armour of Caledor grants the bearer a 6+ ward save and the Fireborn special rule.

optionItems.name: Shadow Armour
optionItems.description: Model on foot only. The wearer of the Shadow Armour has a 5+ armour save. In addition, the wearer has both the Scouts and Strider special rules.

optionItems.name: Shield of the Merwyrm
optionItems.description: Shield. Unless he is fighting with a weapon that has the Requires Two Hands special rule, the bearer of the Shield of the Merwyrm has a parry save of 4+ (even if he's fighting with a magic weapon).

optionItems.name: Golden Crown of Atrazar
optionItems.description: One use only. The Golden Crown of Atrazar bestows a 2+ ward save against the first wounding hit suffered by the wearer (which cancels out not only the Wound, but also any Killing Blow or Multiple Wounds special rules the attack has) after which its power fades and it cannot be used again during the game.

stats.conditionalDescription: * One time use. Only to the first wounding hit (the ward save cancels out Killing Blow or Multiple Wounds special rules).

optionItems.name: Moranion's Wayshard
optionItems.description: Model on foot only. The bearer of Moranion's Wayshard has the Ambushers special rule. He can also give the Ambushers special rule to a friendly Archers or Spearmen unit, up to 30 models in size and chosen from Warhammer: High Elves, immediately before deployment. If he does so, he immediately joins the unit and cannot leave it until the turn after the one in which the combined unit has deployed.

optionItems.name: Khaine's Ring of Fury
optionItems.description: Bound spell (power level 3). Khaine's Ring of Fury contains the Soul Quench spell (see the Lore of High Magic).

optionItems.name: Gem of Sunfire
optionItems.description: One use only. During the turn in which the Gem of Sunfire is used, all of the bearer's spells, shooting attacks and close combat attacks (and his mount's, if he has one) have a +1 bonus To Wound (rolls of 1 still fail) provided that they also have the Flaming Attacks special rule.

optionItems.name: Cloak of Beards
optionItems.description: The wearer of the Cloak of Beards causes Fear. Against models chosen from Warhammer: Dwarfs, the wearer causes Terror instead. However, all models from the Warhammer: Dwarfs gain the Hatred special rule while attacking the wearer. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, roll a D6 for each magic item carried by each model from Warhammer: Dwarfs that is in base contact with the bearer. On a roll of 4+, that magic item is destroyed and cannot be used for the battle. Note that this has no effect on magic items that are mounts, magic items that contain bound spells that have already miscast during the game, and any magic items lavelled as 'one use only' that have already been used during the game - do no roll to see if these magic items are destroyed.

specialRules.conditionalDescription: * Only against models from the Warhammer: Dwarfs book. And those models gain hatred of the bearer.

optionItems.name: Book of Hoeth
optionItems.description: The Book of Hoeth allows the bearer to re-roll a single dice from each of his casting or dispel attempts. Results of 6 cannot be re-rolled.

optionItems.name: Banner of the World Dragon
optionItems.description: All models in a unit that carries the Banner of the World Dragon have a 2+ ward save against all Wounds caused by spells, magic and magical attacks. Furthermore, all Dragons (friend or for) within 12" of the Banner of the World Dragon have the Stubborn special rule.

stats.conditionalDescription: * 2+ Ward Save against spells, magic weapons, and magical attacks.
